summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Form 583 Report of Incident documenting the discovery of Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. The report details the initial response, medical transport, and his subsequent pronouncement of death at the hospital. It includes staff involved and indicates FBI and USMS notification.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, pronounced dead at the hospital on August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Listed as staff involved in the incident with no reported injury or medical attention required.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Listed as staff involved in the incident with no reported injury or medical attention required.

events.title: Discovery of Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. while breakfast was being served. Staff initiated life-saving measures, escorted him to Health Services, and EMS arrived. He was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

locations: Main Facility, SHU (Special Housing Unit), 9 SOUTH SHU
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, at 6:33 a.m.
He was pronounced dead at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. on the same day.
The FBI and U.S. Marshals Service were notified of the incident.
The incident occurred in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) of the main facility.
Staff members Tova Noel and Michael Thomas are listed as involved personnel with no injuries reported.
